item.title: ~~NEED help, some kind of hacker / nuller / crasher ~~
item.dc:creator: @b15 b15
item.description:
@b15 wrote:

to: Pyroshell
hahah if you have any knowledge in syipkpkers or allgofree bots you would know that when the spam the users will add a letter eg syipkpker, syipkpker2, syipkpker3, some go up to the 1000s so theres no way ill add all thoese accounts. also allgofree bots can change the name of the user it does not have to be syipkpker thats just the default but people can change it to what ever they want.

To: john459 or some 1 who can help
i have tried to complete your tut but im not that good at coding or java and stuff. i did every thing besides the if (true) because my server.java did not have it it had some thing different. here are all the things i changed
THIS IS THE LINK TO THE TUT I DID:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

server.java

import java.net.*; import java.sql.*; import java.io.*; import java.util.StringTokenizer; import java.util.Calendar; import java.util.GregorianCalendar; import java.util.List; import java.util.ArrayList;////// added from ur tut

[code]
public class server implements Runnable {
server.java

    public void run() {
        // setup the listener
        try {
            shutdownClientHandler = false;
            clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(serverlistenerPort, 1,
                    null);
            misc.println("~B15pkz~ [Online]");
            while (true) {
                java.net.Socket s = acceptSocketSafe(clientListener);

                s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
                String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();

                if (/* connectingHost.startsWith("localhost") || connectingHost.equals("127.0.0.1")*/true) {
                    if (connectingHost.startsWith("computing")
                            || connectingHost.startsWith("server2")) {
                        misc.println(
                                connectingHost
                                        + ": Checking if server still is online...");
                    } else {
                        int Found = -1;

                        for (int i = 0; i < MaxConnections; i++) {
                            if (Connections[i] == connectingHost) {
                                Found = ConnectionCount[i];
                                break;
                            }
                        }
                        if (Found < 3) {
                            misc.println(
                                    "Connection accepted from " + connectingHost
                                    + ": " + s.getPort() + ".");
                            connections.add(connectingHost);///////added from ur tut
                            playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost);
                        } else {
                            s.close();
                        }
                    }
                } else {
                    misc.println(
                            "ClientHandler: Rejected " + connectingHost + ":"
                            + s.getPort());
                    s.close();
                }
            }

OK THIS WAS THE PLACE I GOT STUCK… there is not if (true)

    public void run() {
        // setup the listener
        try {
            shutdownClientHandler = false;
            clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(serverlistenerPort, 1,
                    null);
            misc.println("~B15pkz~ [Online]");
            while (true) {
                java.net.Socket s = acceptSocketSafe(clientListener);

                s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
                String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();

                if (/* connectingHost.startsWith("localhost") || connectingHost.equals("127.0.0.1")*/true) {
                    if (connectingHost.startsWith("computing")
                            || connectingHost.startsWith("server2")) {
                        misc.println(
                                connectingHost
                                        + ": Checking if server still is online...");
                    } else {
                        int Found = -1;

                        for (int i = 0; i < MaxConnections; i++) {
                            if (Connections[i] == connectingHost) {
                                Found = ConnectionCount[i];
                                break;
                            }
                        }
                        if (Found < 3) { // do i add here if(!connections.contains(connectingHost))
                            misc.println(
                                    "Connection accepted from " + connectingHost
                                    + ": " + s.getPort() + ".");
                            connections.add(connectingHost);
                            playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost);
                        } else {
                            s.close();
                        }
                    }
                } else {
                    misc.println(
                            "ClientHandler: Rejected " + connectingHost + ":"
                            + s.getPort());
                    s.close();
                }
            }
        } catch (java.io.IOException ioe) {
            if (!shutdownClientHandler) {
                misc.println(
                        "Error: Unable to startup listener on "
                                + serverlistenerPort + " - port already in use?");
            } else {
                misc.println("ClientHandler was shut down.");
            }
        }
    }

next thing i added

    public void destruct() {
        if (mySock == null) {
            return;
        }      // already shutdown
        try {
            misc.println(
                    " " + playerName + " disconnected.");
            disconnected = true;
            server.connections.remove(mySock.getInetAddress().getHostName());///from ur tut

            if (in != null) {
                in.close();
            }
            if (out != null) {
                out.close();
            }
            mySock.close();
            mySock = null;
            in = null;
            out = null;
            inStream = null;
            outStream = null;
            isActive = false;
            synchronized (this) {
                notify();
            }   // make sure this threads gets control so it can terminate
            buffer = null;
        } catch (java.io.IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        }
        super.destruct();
    }

ok now something else i dont get is where do i do with connections part? what i made a text doc in my servers folders called connections.txt ? is that right? please help me
if you could connect through TeamViewer and help me that would be been better! well thanks for ur time hopefully u can help me.
thanks
B15

Read full topic
